Key Match Events: Haliburton tallied 25 points, 10 assists, three steals and two rebounds while Siakam added 25 points and nine rebounds in Indiana's 108-96.
Former Pacer Buddy Hield helped lead the Warriors with 17 points on 6-of-19 shooting from the field with three made 3-pointers.
Pat Spencer notched a new career-high with 18 points on 7-of-12 shooting from the floor in 20 minutes.
Rookie Quinten Post made an appearance on Friday, scoring six points in seven minutes off the bench. The rookie out of Boston College buried his first career 3-pointer against the Pacers.
Pre-Game Insights: Without the firepower of Curry and others, the shorthanded Warriors couldn't pace Indiana's duo of Tyrese Haliburton and Pascal Siakam.
Post-Match Reflections: After a back-to-back, the Warriors will get the weekend off before traveling north for a contest with the Toronto Raptors on Monday.
